meanings.definition: To jump over (a hurdle) while running.
meanings.sent1: The athlete hurdled over the obstacle effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: She hurdled the fence to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent3: The cat hurdled over the sleeping dog, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: He hurdled the final barrier to victory in the race.
meanings.sent5: The horse hurdled the fallen tree with grace and speed.

meanings.sent1: Despite the challenges, she hurdled all the obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent2: He hurdled the language barrier by practicing every day.
meanings.sent3: The team hurdled the setback and continued with determination.
meanings.sent4: She hurdled the fear of failure and pursued her dreams.
meanings.sent5: They hurdled the financial difficulties and succeeded in their business.

meanings.sent1: She quickly hurdled over the barrier and won the race.
meanings.sent2: He hurdled the wall and landed safely on the other side.
meanings.sent3: The cat hurdled the fence and disappeared into the garden.
meanings.sent4: The athlete hurdled the hurdle with ease during practice.
meanings.sent5: They hurdled the stream and continued their hike in the forest.
